events.name: GDG January Meeting

venue.name: Ball Communication Building Ball State University

events.description: It is time to get your web game back. A quick guide to awesome resources provided by Google and things many of us have access to as BSU Staff/Faculty/Students. Each of projects we show have similar goals in making the web a better place, each project takes it a slightly different direction. Join us at 1PM on Friday to see the differences.

events.name: Internet of Thing Meetup

venue.name: Ball Communication Building Ball State University

events.description:
We have all heard the buzzword "Internet of things", it is different things to different people... lets talk about what it is to you and other smart people.

If we have enough interest in this topic for an evening meeting we can schedule one for the evening as well.

events.name: November Developer meetup...

venue.name: Ball Communication Building Ball State University

events.description:
Just some developers chatting... talking about projects they are working on.

If you would like an evening event. We can do that as well. 

https://plus.google.com/b/105076625948887697816/events/cicnd4tln9btv5a8nijclnket5c

events.name: HTTP and HTTP2... Brothers from another Mother

venue.name: Ball Communication Building Ball State University

events.description: HTTP2... We can have nice things... and they are coming... in the name of HTTP2... We can talk about browsers and how they work... and how they will work and how they can work... lots of good stuff.
events.how_to_find_us: We will be in BC 220 and will totally be the biggest nerds in the room

events.name: Beginning Android Study Jam
events.description:
We are excited to announce that GDG Muncie will be hosting Android Study Jam sessions this March. 

This year’s Study Jam will be oriented around Udacity’s Android for Beginners course. This course is best suited for those new to programming and those with programming experience who have never used Android. 

 We will be hosting the Study Jam at the Innovation Connector on Monday evenings throughout the month of March and the first Monday In April. Times: 5:30-8:00pm 

By Feb 29th the lessons that should be studied by the 1st meeting will be posted. The course is structured into three main lessons and a final project. During the first several weeks we’ll review the lessons as a group and during the last week work on final projects. The link below is a link to sign up for the Udacity Course. 

https://www.udacity.com/account/affiliate/GoogleStudyJams

To Launch the event Google will be having a live Hangout on Thursday February 4th at 6PM EST. https://plus.google.com/events/c91ccjj6745t0r4e4sh9ki3sqd0 

More info about those bringing the local StudyJam to you is posted at http://ilearn.bsu.edu/studyjam/ 

RSVP to this event to be registered for the StudyJam!
events.how_to_find_us: Enter the building... we are in there someplace

events.name: Beginning Android Study Jam
events.description:
This will be the final Study Jam night... :_( 

We will be showing our final projects to each other and figuring our where we go from here.

T-shirts have been ordered... those that finish the final project will get a T-shirt and their Udacity certificate.

events.name: Firebase Team Post I/O LIVE!!!
events.description:
Join us for a two-hour live streamed developer

#AskFirebase

Q&A from wherever you are. On May 26th at 6:00 PM EST you will be able to ask James Tamplin co-founder of Firebase, and Magnus Hyttsten Firebase Developer Advocate, questions about Firebase, LIVE! Make sure to start posting your questions today on Google+ and Twitter with the hashtag : "#AskFirebaseLive"

I very much hope you can join us. Firebase was amazing... now it has a few more tricks. Come check it out.

events.name: Progressive Web Apps
events.description:
The web is an awesome platform and continues to get better. Come hang out with other developers and see where the platform is and where it is going in the near future. We will have some code labs and some awesome round table discussions.

More details coming soon.

SAVE THE DATE!

PWA Day!

events.name: Devs Night Out...
events.description:
Election day... All votes are cast... lets not talk of politics... lets talk about what we are working on. 

Not exactly social hour... not really working... but a nice evening not talking about politics... but instead talking about other cool stuff. No formal presentations are scheduled for this evening out.
events.how_to_find_us: We will be the ones talking about out projects...

events.name: DEVFEST MUNCIE!!!!!
events.description:
This event is currently being planned. But I want you to save the date for December 3rd for DevFest Muncie. The entire day will be a two tracks each touching on IOT... with hardware and software all talking to the internet it looks to be a cool day.

Lunch will be provided. 
We are currently seeking additional sponsorship for the event. 

For this event I am moving registration over to eventbrite. The ticketing system is more flexible.
Visit eventbrite to order a ticket : 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/devfest-muncie-iot-hackday-tickets-28761997910

This event will be kept on meetup for tracking purposes... But being registered here does not ensure a ticket.

events.name: Talk about Project Tango
events.description:
Tango (formerly Project Tango) is an Augmented reality Computing platform, developed and authored by Google. It uses computer vision to enable mobile devices, such as smartphones and tablets, to detect their position relative to the world around them without using GPS or other external signals.

Travis Cheek has had an interest in 3D scanning and  indoor mapping. Travis has recently has gotten his hands on the the first commercially available Tango phone. I personally look forward to the overview and invite discussion and question related to indoor mapping and computer vision.
events.how_to_find_us: We will be inside... Not the board room... but the big room

events.name: Cloud Next ’17 Extended - Muncie
events.description:
On March 8-10th Google held an event called "Cloud Next 17". We are running a "Cloud Next Extended" in Muncie. What should you expect at the Extended event.

You will be given ample time to work your way though well thought out code labs to help build your skill and your knowledge of the Google Cloud Platform. There will be discussion of not just the how... but the why of cloud computing. Mostly we hope it is a casual day of fun and computing.

Here is the run down of the day. 

10:00AM-3PM - Hanging out with other awesome developers chatting about the cloud in the age of acceleration!

10:00AM-Noon - Self paced code labs

Noon-1:30PM Lunch and Could Next 17 Keynotes highlights

1:30-3:00 Group Lab or Self Paced Lab

2:55PM - Double Secret prize handed out to one participant that wants it! It is an awesome prize... one I know I want!

Feel free to use Twitter to let people know you are coming... In social media posts about the event please use #GoogleNext17 #extended #gdgMuncie
events.how_to_find_us: We are in the Co:Lab... It is a Saturday... We might be the only ones in there...

events.name: Ok Google! Tell me about Google Home and Assistant.
events.description: Come join us to learn more about Google Home, Actions on Google, and Google Assistant. Check out a project being developed at Ball State for prospective students and their parents during orientation. And for good measure, we'll talk about Alexa from Amazon as well.

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2017
events.description: It is that time of year again to reflect on the announcements that Google has made at Google I/O. This year we will feature... we don't know... we will be as surprised to know what they are cooking up as you are. There are a few people from around town that are attending the event live and will share their insights to the non-broadcasted as well as the broadcasted portions of the event. It will be one for the books and we look forward to your attendance.
events.how_to_find_us: We will be in the CO:Lab space in MADJAX... Enter the MadJAX Complex on the north side of the building. We will be directly on the right.

events.name: Google I/O Extended GDG Muncie -  BSU!
events.description: It is that time of year again to reflect on the announcements that Google has made at Google I/O. This year we will feature... we don't know... we will be as surprised to know what they are cooking up as you are. There are a few people from around town that are attending the event live and will share their insights to the non-broadcasted as well as the broadcasted portions of the event. It will be one for the books and we look forward to your attendance.

events.name: Polymer... Design... Other stuff...
events.description:
We are skipping the July meetup and we are heading to August. On the first Thursday in August we are going to talk about the Polymer Project (Which recently went to version 2) ... Design... and other stuff... We are getting new members joining on meetup every other day and I hope to meet them and find out what they know. 

This is not a sponsored meetup so there is not a catered dinner.

I look forward to see you all and seeing what is on your mind.

I am going to schedule the Muncie Design UX Meetup at 6:30PM... This will be the first actual meeting of that group. I hope people from GDG Muncie can stay for that... but if not I understand.

events.name: DevFest Muncie!
events.description:
We are preparing a day of development, design, defence, and fun. DevFest Muncie 2017 will be announced very soon and this could be seen as the save the date page.

We hope you can join us for DevFest Muncie 2017! 

After party will be on the other side of the building at the newly opened Guardian Brewery.

Tickets are on sale now!

https://devfestmuncie.eventbrite.com/
events.how_to_find_us: We will be the large group hanging out in the Co:Lab

events.name: Mobile Site Certification Study Jam
events.description:
Want to sharpen your mobile web skills? Join our study jam to get mobile site certified!

The Mobile Sites certification is a professional accreditation that Google offers to individuals who demonstrate proficiency in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. A Mobile Sites certification allows individuals to demonstrate that Google recognizes them as an expert in mobile sites.

This is a chance to get a professional accreditation that demonstrates you have an understanding of basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. By learning together we think it’s going to be more fun and more of us are going to be able to complete it.

Benefits include:

• Certificate: Show that you're a certified mobile sites professional with a personalized certificate that you can print!

• Profile page: Share your expertise with a Google Partners public profile page that lists your certifications.

This meetup will explain the benefits of getting certified, how to get certified, and how to share and communicate your certification status with others.

Doors open at 9:30AM and we start studying at 10:00AM. 5:00PM was down as the end time. Most people will have been done for quite a while before that. But I want to give time to make sure that everyone is comfortable with the material before they start the test. 

All attendees must bring their own laptop.

events.name: GDG Muncie Holiday Dinner
events.description:
• What we'll do

Lets get together and have dinner. Since GDG Muncie had a rather eventful year I think we should have dinner. I will buy the food and you buy your drink. Seem reasonable?

We will also be having a GDG Muncie Holiday Luncheon... If you can't attend this meetup which is during the evening then please look into attending the Holiday Luncheon.

• What to bring

You just need to bring yourself... And proof that you signed up for GDG Muncie on meetup. You will also be leaving with a small gift from GDG Muncie.

• Important to know

You can only attend the Holiday Luncheon or Dinner if you have previously been to a GDG Muncie event. If you were at any of the meetings we had this year or DevFest you qualify. We are usually pretty lax as if you are signed up for meetup and don't RSVP... for these events you must RSVP!

events.name: GDG Muncie Holiday Luncheon
events.description:
• What we'll do
Lets get together and have lunch. Since GDG Muncie had a rather eventful year I think we should have lunch. I will buy the food and you buy your drink. Seem reasonable?
We will also be having a GDG Muncie Holiday Dinner... If you can't attend this meetup which is during the day please look into attending the Holiday Dinner.

• What to bring
You just need to bring yourself... And proof that you signed up for GDG Muncie on meetup. You will also be leaving with a small gift from GDG Muncie.

• Important to know
You can only attend the Holiday Luncheon or Dinner if you have previously been to a GDG Muncie event. If you were at any of the meetings we had this year or DevFest you qualify. We are usually pretty lax as if you are signed up for meetup and don't RSVP... for these events you must RSVP!

events.name: Start learning WebVR
events.description:
• What we'll do
We will go over a brief history of WebVR followed by a gentle introduction to A-Frame.

• What to bring
If you want to follow along and take notes bring a laptop... But you don't have to..

• Important to know
events.how_to_find_us: Enter the Building on the north side of the building... That will make finding us a whole lot easier

events.name: Hackaday World Create Day
events.description:
• What we'll do
Hackaday World Create Day is on March 17th and it’s happening near you. Get together with hackers in your area and create something. For the area of Muncie we will have Steve Dalcher walking those in attendance though the processes you would have to go though to get started with 3D printing and laser cutting. We will have some live demonstrations and a Q&A session after for those interested in 3D printing and laser cutting (rapid prototyping). Chris Turvey will be talking about the ESP32 and the ESP8266 microcontrollers. Chris will be talking about how to set up the Arduino environment to start programming these boards.
If you are working on something cool then bring it with you and show us!

• What to bring
Questions, curosity, awesome projects you are working on (if you want too... totally optional)! • Important to know
All GDG Muncie events are inclusive events where developers, designers, and entrepreneurs of all skill levels, genders, religions, and backgrounds are welcome to learn, practice, and share technologies, services, and platforms. Our motto is “Be excellent to each other;” if you see or experience anything different please contact the organizers.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Muncie
events.description:
Google I/O is an annual event hosted by Google to highlight the latest in technology and product innovation. This covers topics such as the IoT, working with material design, advancements in mobile technology, Machine Learning and so much more.
Google I/O Extended Muncie will be an evening hangout talking about what things Google released the previous week. We might watch some of the keynote. We will talk about all of the new stuff and all of the old stuff. Right now we can promise dinner and a few stories of cutting edge technology.
All skill levels and ages are invited to come out and join the festivities.

events.name: Google Cloud Next Extended 2018
events.description:
Join GDG Muncie as we celebrate and learn about the exciting announcements at Google Cloud Next (https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/)! We will start off with some food and networking. We will then kick off with highlights from the event last week and transition to an open discussion.

Agenda:
6:00 - 6:30 Food, Drinks, and Networking
6:30 - 8:00 Announcement Recap/Discussion

Get started with Google Cloud today! Don't have an account? Fear not! New users can register (https://cloud.google.com/free/) and receive $300.00 in credits (which last 12 months), and also you can leverage the Always Free tier (https://cloud.google.com/free/).

events.name: Flutter Study Jam 2018 -- GDG Muncie
events.description:
What?
Flutter Study Jams are Community-run study groups based on the Flutter Udacity Course. Participants learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.

Why?
Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn Flutter in person and support them to complete the course. Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

Who?
Flutter Study Jam is suited best for: 1) those just getting started with mobile app development 2) those with programming experience on other mobile app frameworks.

Udacity
https://www.udacity.com/course/build-native-mobile-apps-with-flutter--ud905

Flutter Docs
https://flutter.io/docs/

*** bring your laptop ***
This will be night one of a two night series... This is to make sure everyone is at a great starting point to work though the Udacity course though week and we will all work up to a certain point before we finish up in part 2 next week!

events.name: Flutter Study Jam 2018 -- GDG Muncie -- Part 2
events.description:
What?
Flutter Study Jams are Community-run study groups based on the Flutter Udacity Course. Participants learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.

Why?
Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn Flutter in person and support them to complete the course. Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

Who?
Flutter Study Jam is suited best for: 1) those just getting started with mobile app development 2) those with programming experience on other mobile app frameworks.

Udacity
https://www.udacity.com/course/build-native-mobile-apps-with-flutter--ud905

Flutter Docs
https://flutter.io/docs/

*** bring your laptop ***
This will be night two of a two night series... There will be a point that we break on Night one and a point set that you should be before showing up at this meetup... We will finish the course and give everyone kudos for getting this done in just over a week!

events.name: DevFest Muncie 2018
events.description:
DevFest Muncie 2018 is coming November 3rd... Currently the day is still being planned but you can be certain we will be talking about Machine Learning, AR, IoT and a ton of other topics.
visit : https://devfestmuncie.eventbrite.com/ for more details.
#DevFest2018
#DevFest18

events.name: Building the Santa Tracker
events.description:
Seasons Greetings... It is that time of year that Google puts out its Santa tracker. It is everywhere... it is on mobile... it is on the web... even your Google Assistant has a few activities related to this experience. I would love to take an evening to share with you how this is built and what the underlying technology is for this amazing... Ok... to be honest... this isn't going to be about the Santa Tracker at all... it is going to be a sit down dinner with member of GDG Muncie at someplace in Muncie. Dinner will be provided by GDG Muncie for members that have made it to previous meetings in the past year and that includes DevFest.
A location will be set soon.

Sign up for the meeting so I can e-mail you directly with more information about this meeting and I look forward to seeing you soon.

--Chris

events.name: CANCELLED : Machine Learning Crash Course
events.description:
THIS MEETING WILL BE RESCHEDULED IN EARLY FEBRUARY.

Brush up on your Python... We will have a busy day busting through the tutorials lined up in the Google Machine Learning Crash Course. We will work with Python to learn how to use TensorFlow in order to get the basics of Machine Learning to work for us. We will learn how to frame questions that are problems that Machine Learning can solve.

Please check out the prerequisite portion of the Crash Course site to make sure you are ready.
https://developers.google.com/machine-learning/crash-course/
During the day we will rely heavily on the others in the room and this site to guide our quest into ML.

--Chris

events.description:

If you missed part one you have some time to get up to speed. Visit the Crash Course site and follow the exercies through "First Steps with TF".

--Chris

group_profile.intro: One of those guys that loves technology for the sake of technology and wishes to pass it along to others. My passions and tastes grew faster than my talent for technology and I am finally catching up.
